'0' |presidents'_trophies = '0' |division_titles = '1' (2007â08)
|playoff_appearances = '3' |website = [http://wild.nhl.com/ wild.nhl.com] }} The
'Minnesota Wild' are an ice hockey team based in St. Paul, Minnesota, United
States. [http://wild.nhl.com/ Minnesota Wild ] They are members of the Central
Division http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=678456&navid=DL|NHL|home
of the Western Conference, of the National Hockey League
(NHL). [http://wild.nhl.com/index.html The Official Web Site - Minnesota Wild ] Though the team plays in the Minneapolis-St. Paul
area with the Minnesota Twins, Vikings, Lynx and Timberwolves, the Wild and the
Swarm (also owned by the Wild ownership) are the only Major League sports
franchises to play in St. Paul, as the aforementioned teams all play in
Minneapolis.

The team was founded on June 25, 1997, but started playing in the 2000-01 NHL
season. The Wild is also the first NHL franchise in Minnesota since the
Minnesota North Stars moved to Dallas in 1993. They lost their first game, 3â1,
to the Mighty Ducks of Anaheim and recorded their first win against the Tampa
Bay Lightning five games later. [http://www.hockey-
reference.com/teams/MIN/2001.html 2000-01 Minnesota Wild Roster and Statistics |
Hockey-Reference.com ] The Wild play at the
Xcel Energy Center. [http://wild.nhl.com/club/page.htm?id=51214 Minnesota
Wild Tickets - Minnesota Wild - Tickets ] In
the 2002â03 NHL season, the team made its first playoff appearance, and made a
surprising run to the Western Conference Finals. [http://www.hockey-
reference.com/playoffs/NHL_2003.html 2003 NHL Playoffs Summary | Hockey-Reference.com ]

Minnesota currently has two minor-league affiliates, the Houston Aeros of the
AHL and the Orlando Solar Bears of the ECHL. [http://www.twincities.com/sports/ci_20594975/minnesota-wild-signs-
affiliation-deal-orlando-solar-bears Minnesota Wild, Orlando Solar Bears ink
affiliation deal - TwinCities.com ] On April
18, 2013, it was announced that the Aeros would be moving to Des Moines, Iowa,
beginning with the 2013â14 AHL season, where they will play at Wells Fargo Arena
and be known as the Iowa Wild.

The team's first minor-league affiliate was the Cleveland Lumberjacks of the
IHL, who folded after the 2000-01 season. [http://ech.case.edu/ech-
cgi/article.pl?id=CL2 Encyclopedia of Cleveland History:CLEVELAND LUMBERJACKS ] As of 2013, the Wild have averaged a .526 points
percentage since entering the league. [http://www.hockey-
reference.com/teams/MIN/ Minnesota Wild Franchise Index | Hockey-Reference.com ]
categories: Professional ice hockey teams in Minnesota
National Hockey League in Minneapolis–Saint Paul
